intro: Pleomele hanningtonii, commonly known as the Hannington’s pleomele, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, thick-stemmed structure and fleshy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
